intro: Lepidium bupleuroides, commonly known as clustered whitlow grass, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches a height of 10–30 cm. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are linear and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is native to the western United States and thrives in dry, disturbed soils.
